title.native: ディメンション ダブリュー

description:
In the year 2071, the world's energy problems seem solved by a network of cross-dimensional electric-field inductors- "coils" -that extract energy from a seemingly infinite source. That source is the W dimension, a fourth plane that exists beyond the X, Y, and Z dimensions.

In this world, unofficial "illegal" coils harness powers that the police can't hope to counter. Dealing with these coils is the job of coil-hating repo man Kyoma, whose run-in with the unique coil android Mira leads the two to form a reluctant partnership.

(Source: FUNimation)
synonyms: มิติปริศนา

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

node.description: [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩原裕二)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kantakamei) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀井幹太)

Adept in various fields related to computer graphics.

Close friends with [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/).

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuyu_yuyuo) | [Tumblr](https://yuyuoto.tumblr.com/)

[Website](http://xfoxtailsx.com) | [Artist Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/foxtails/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/foxtails_kon)

**Introduction:**
Fo'xTails (フォックステイルズ) was a Japanese five-piece rock-band under record label Lantis (2015-2018).

**Final Members:**
- [Takao](https://anilist.co/staff/163423/Takao-Sakuma) (タカオ) - vocalist
- Narukaze (鳴風) - guitarist
- Sakamoto Takayuki (坂本尭之) - bassist
- [TERA](https://anilist.co/staff/153833/Kenji-Terazono) (テラ) - guitarist, programmer

**Former Members:**
- Takahiro (峻洋) - drummer

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.
**Shoutarou Suga** was a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cnago) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/椎名豪)

Masaru Shiina, known professionally as Go Shiina, is a freelance composer and arranger.

He joined Namco in 1997, and was best known during his time with the company for writing music for a number of games in the Tales, Mr. Driller, and God Eater franchises, He gained widespread recognition with his score for Tales of Legendia in 2005. Since then, he has also contributed music for several titles in the Tekken, Ace Combat, and The Idolmaster franchises.

In anime he is most noted for the score of [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/) together with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

__[Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/stereodivefoundation/bio.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Stereo Dive Foundation__ is the solo sound making project of Japanese musician [Ryuuta Iida](https://anilist.co/staff/106037), otherwise known as Ron (stylized as R・O・N)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1576069694750326785) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/檜垣亮)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kantakamei) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀井幹太)

Adept in various fields related to computer graphics.

Close friends with [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/208154066)
Occasional scriptwriter. Started off at [Bee Train](https://anilist.co/studio/5/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kantakamei) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀井幹太)

Adept in various fields related to computer graphics.

Close friends with [Kazuto Nakazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101474/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/r0lgg61npxdambb)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福田道生)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Debuted as a director on [Hyakko](https://anilist.co/anime/4550/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/orbitcommand001)

Close friends with [Kenji Kamiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100348/).
